page.title: 14CUBS AND BROWNIES, THWAITES
page.content: Late in 1984 both Cub Scout and Brownie Guide Packs were reformed in Thwaites Parish after a lapse of many years. Two local ladies are Akela and Chil for the Cubs, and two others are Brown Owl and Snowy Owl for the Brownies. The meetings are held in The Green Village Hall once a week. Twelve girls go to Brownies and fourteen boys to Cubs. In February 1985 the Cubs and Brownies held a joint coffee morning in Millom, (the nearest town) to raise funds. Both Cubs and Brownies enjoy playing games, working towards badges, going for walks and on expeditions. They are organised in sixes for team games and general organisation. The Brownie sixes are Gnomes, Sprites and Pixies and the Cub sixes are Blue. Yellow and Green. All the children say they enjoy going to meetings.
